website_summaries.verdict: The 5.11 Tactical Rush backpack is a true day pack or overnight bag for outdoor activities, not necessarily a practical book bag or carry on. Reinforced seams and zippers provide extra security.
pros: Tactical design optimal for camping and hiking
Draw cord allows for expansion when necessary
cons: Not ideal for transporting laptops or other electronic devices
Waist belt not included in design

customer_reviews.title: Liked it so much I bought two
customer_reviews.text: I would recommend this bag to anyone looking for a 24 hour sized pack. Lots of storage options in the lower pocket one zippered and one mesh and one zippered pocket on each side at the top. Makes finding the small items that you put in easy to locate.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Allen Rose

customer_reviews.title: Wearing one of these in OD green or coyote in public is going to make you look like a wannabe service member
customer_reviews.text: Such quality. I would suggest black unless you are using it for an outdoor purpose. Wearing one of these in OD green or coyote in public is going to make you look like a wannabe service member. Beyond that, it is one of the best made products i have ever purchased. I mean that quite literally. Don't believe me? head to a store that sells them, and have a feel of the material, and construction. You will be impressed. Then you will come back to Amazon to buy it for cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Guy4Game

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: A superb bag for EDC. Black always looks clean and professional. Pockets, pouches, and compartments galore. Hands down, the most comfortable bag I've ever worn. Hip belt not needed, but attachment points are there for those that want one. I expect this to last 10-20 years. Was fun packing out for a 3 day trip last fall. Stuffed to the max, no trouble as carry-on with American Airlines. - I did add a side pouch for drinks. One that easily detached as my "personal item" on flights. - for EDC, the 2 compression straps work okay-ish at reducing the profile but could be revamped to pull at 4 points without interfering with the side pockets.
customer_reviews.author: elpat

customer_reviews.title: Good materials but usage is a bit... finicky.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - weight - material - seams Cons: - There’s just so much organization and zippers that it’s borderline cumbersome getting things in and out quickly. - The front pouch’s zippers always get stuck at the corner apex when opening/closing. - Wished there was a false bottom or some padding at the bottom to protect contents when placing/throwing down. - Not for casual use/appearance. People *will* indeed think you are “carrying”.
customer_reviews.author: FF

customer_reviews.title: The bag you are looking for.
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag. I use it daily as my EMS duty bag for my two jobs, and it holds all my gear AND personal gear too. I can fit my BLS supplies, iPad, stationary supplies, chargers, headphones, toiletries, pillow, water and snacks, and more in here with no issue! The weight is nothing with how comfortable the straps and padding are. The MOLLE system all over allows for even more storage, which is great for adapting this bag to an instant search and rescue day bag, or downgrading to a station bedside catch-all. It's durable, sleek, and absolutely worth the price. I would highly recommend this to anyone in need of a true gear bag.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Most impressive
customer_reviews.text: Excellent bag. I would rather it a100 stars if I could. The only bag I have every used that got me compliments from multiple people. Like great and is everyone high quality and sturdy. Pretty much abused it and still no sign of wear it test. This bag will last you for years of you take care of it. The best bag I've ever used I'm so glad I bought it. Great for college or everyday use and great for weekend trips as well. Multiple compartment and extremely functional. No brainier. I can't recommend this enough. If you can but I've bag for everything you need then get this. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Ziaul Azim Chowdhury

customer_reviews.title: Good balance of price & performance
customer_reviews.text: Love my Maxpedition Pygmy necklace great quality, but need something *bigger* that won't run me mid $200's. And I loved my 5.11 covert cargo pants. Was all I wore - till they got cute and *retired* the line (flipped to Wrangler Riggs, but I digress...). So I figured I'd try a 5.11 pack: oh yeah! Great idea! Good quality, good value. Not as cheap as the anonymous Chinese brands, but certainIy well made and built to last. Excellent deign planning went into this. No its not quite as high quality as a mapped. But you're paying half the price!
customer_reviews.author: T. Kadrie

customer_reviews.title: Very water resistant and strong construction
customer_reviews.text: Its a 5.11 pack so I came at this with high expectations and it did not disappoint. Even through heavy rainfall, this pack stayed completely dry. Long multi-day hikes and this pack not only holds up perfectly but it also was very comfortable (however I will be getting a hip-strap for additional ease). The pack comes with loops to attach hip strap and is highly recommended that you get one to accompany this pack (if you will be carrying a heavy load). Tons of storage and little organizers everywhere in the pack and mollying on outside allows for more. zippers are strong and durable (which is what fails on many other packs).
customer_reviews.author: Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Great for my car EDC kit
customer_reviews.text: Great bag for keeping everything for my cars EDC kit organized. The bag is a very high quality and so you get what you pay for. I got a lot of stuff packed in this bag. Everyday common items to items needed if I become stranded in bad weather. Several years ago I found myself stranded after a bad snow/ice storm. Ever since that day I’ve become obsessed with having a prepared kit in my car of everything I could need for everyday events to extreme stranded events like I experienced. It was a really bad day and a 20 minute drive home became a 6 hour ordeal. I learned a lot from that day on being better prepared.
customer_reviews.author: D Hill

customer_reviews.title: Very happy. Excellent job as always
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband to replace his old bag for the fire department. It has SO MUCH room in it! He fits a few pairs of pants, shorts, 8 shirts, his binders and books for studying, his towel, laundry bag, and his little odds and ends. There's still room for a 2nd shift of uniforms. He loves this bag and is always thanking me for it. A few guys at the department have picked one up since he's marketed it to them. Paired it with the black Velcro American flag on the front. Tons of possibilities and compartments. Very happy. Excellent job as always, 5.11!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: E.D.C.-B.O.B and everything in between
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my every day backpack. You will have PLENTY of room for just about anything and everything you can think of. Personally, I'd as a hip belt for more weight distribution if you're using it for camping but...the chest strap will give you great support overall. I really like the "shove" pouches on the side for a small first aid kit, work gloves or just extra items. You won't regret buying this pack. It's sturdy, well built and will take care of all your gear.
customer_reviews.author: Super Soul

customer_reviews.title: I love this bag.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this bag... great amount of storage space, plus the straps are VERY comfortable when carrying a heavy load for a long time. I'm a large guy, and the bag fits me fantastically. The molly system is a bonus and it's been a great daily use bag for me. I keep toying with the idea of the 72, but haven't ran out of space yet. I had been using Chrome bags for years, but there was never enough space and after long periods of walking the straps would tear into me. I wish I had bought this bag years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Posner

customer_reviews.title: 8 years Review
customer_reviews.text: Was thinking about my gear and realized that this bag has been going strong since 2012. Carried almost everyday for school, for work, on deployments, and personal travel. Everything’s held up amazingly and I havent held back on this bag in the least. Strong and comfortable, best $130 I’ve probably ever spent in my life. Sprayed it with Scotch Guard at some point for rain protection, don’t really worry about that stuff anymore, just an all around great bag. Knock on wood haven’t had a single issue with zippers or fabric and if I cleaned it up I could probably pass it for new. Will buy a new one at 10 years just because it’s been so great so far.
customer_reviews.author: cc

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME BAG
customer_reviews.text: I'm not going to write a 2 page review right now, but I could for this bag! this bag is everything I need. I use it for work but can easily convert it to a camp bag or whatever i need. nice selection of pockets with customizable molle loops. I'm big on organization and bags and did a lot of researching other bags before i sprung for this one and im glad i did. i toss this bag around and keep it pretty heavy, the only issue ive had is the zipper pulls coming apart. I used black 550 cord to make all new nice zipper pulls and we''re good to go now
customer_reviews.author: Branden

customer_reviews.title: Seems to b very well built
customer_reviews.text: If you are decideing between the Ruck 12 or Ruck 24, buy the 24. If deciding between the 24 or the 72, buy the 72. 12 is tiny, I use it to hold my lunch and thats it. The 24 does hold my size 11 boots, uniform, and skivvies. Which is all I need it for really. Not sure if its worth the price. Time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely incredible backpack..
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a backpack that I’d had for ten years. This backpack will last me the rest of my life. INCREDIBLY well made and STRONG. More compartments and zippers and hiding spots than you could ever use. It’s a fun bag to have. All the zippers, pockets, nooks and crannies makes me feel like I’m ten years old playing a secret spy game. And the entire MOLLE system just ads to it. The attachments that you can attach seem never ending and you can customize the outside in a million ways. I HIGHLY recommend this bag. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: John Lepine

customer_reviews.title: 5.11 RUSH24 Military Tactical Backpack, Molle Rucksack, Style 58601, Sandstone.
customer_reviews.text: Without a doubt the most functional medium size pack I have ever owned. Designed with functionality and operational capability in mind this is an outstanding piece of equipment and has far more carry capacity than its initial appearance. Although I originally bought it for work as a ‘get home pack’, on reconsideration I have consigned it to wilderness use and have set it up for that purpose. I’m still undecided as to whether I buy a second RUSH24 or a RUSH12. Either way these are a high quality Pack. I look forward to field testing it.
customer_reviews.author: Wolfshead

customer_reviews.title: Just what I need for office and travel.
customer_reviews.text: Just what I need for travel and the office. Plenty of pockets and larger storage areas. Been taking it through TSA with no issues and fits UNDER most airline seats when loaded up with plenty of must have items. If you pack it to the max you may not get it under a seat but then you can put it in overhead storage. Holding up great! Also great on the HD when you need to have a little extra room for packing away some additional items.
customer_reviews.author: Hans Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Day hikes, EDC, and weekends
customer_reviews.text: Great bag.... I used the RUSH12 for day hikes in the Grand Canyon, Bryce and Zion and now as my EDC, laptop to work, etc. Only down side is papers can get creased with everything else shoved in like they might with any bag. I do have a bit of wear on the pads at the bottom where it meets your back - I assume these are to help keep the bag from moving/rubbing. I got the RUSH24 for weekend trips, the 12 was a bit small for that. Very pleased with both bags.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Tactical Backpack
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't quite sure which size to buy but am very glad I bought this one, the RUSH12 would have been too small in comparison. This is my "go bag" for disaster relief flights and can fit a ton of gear in it. Also love the MOLLE attachments for all my external gear that I need to reach quickly. Build quality is superb, absolutely love this bag! Worth every penny and would certainly buy again.
customer_reviews.author: BP

customer_reviews.title: Good backpack
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of space, very durable and definitely living up to 5.11 brand standards. I carry lots of books, when used to travel for work. This thing can handle a lot of weight and has pleeeenty of space. When I had to pack my stuff and leave in a rush, I would stuff anything and everything in this backpack that I couldn't fit in my suitcase. It worked!!! It is pricey, but I believe well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Saved

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Pack!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pack to replace my last 5.11 pack that was bought to replace a North Face ( that I still have), and this pack is more than awesome. I usually take it on hikes and runs it the market for sustenance and, this pack delivers in spades. I try to see what I "can't fit" in this pack but it handles it all. And whats not pictured but in the pockets are various tactical doo-dads and first aid gear. This pack gets a full recommendation.
customer_reviews.author: GUS

customer_reviews.title: Extremely well made!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son for school use. He regularly goes through bags due to the amount of books he has to haul. This bag is extremely well made and more compartments than he has stuff! The padding in the back and strap area is very comfortable to lug a heavy load. Zippers are very well made and much better than most bags we have used. I am considering buying one for myself for range use.
customer_reviews.author: James C

customer_reviews.title: Perfect in every way possible
customer_reviews.text: I spent my whole life carrying a ruck every day. Have been through a lot of rucks, cheap and expensive. And the 5.11 Rush makes the other ones look useless in comparison. The Rush has more compartments that make it easier to organize in a modular style. I could write a long list of pros and cons but it wouldn’t matter since I have yet to find a con to mention. Incredibly comfortable to carry with its stiff insert that has a little give but retains its function.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Long

customer_reviews.title: The best backpack you can get at this price
customer_reviews.text: I've long seen these backpacks on military bases and when a co-worker got one, I asked where he got it. As soon as I knew that, I ordered mine and I could not be happier. This has a ton of storage and numerous pockets and other organizational helps all through the backpack. In addition, this is ruggedly built to last and last and withstand some of the typical abuse you might expect when outdoors. In just a few weeks, I've already beat mine up through a couple short trips and it keeps coming back for more, with NO hints of any problems. In my opinion, this is a GREAT value.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Lauer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect midsized bag
customer_reviews.text: Excellent bag with lots of pockets, so it's easy to maintain separation, and it's been extremely versatile as an overnight bag, school bag, and bugout bag since I've owned it. For size reference, it easily fits one change of clothes plus a heavy jacket, but not much more than that, in the main compartment. If a RUSH36 existed, that would be the ultimate bag for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Phipps

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for most. Very well made. Comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I was deciding between this and the Rush 12. Definitely glad I went with the 24! It is the perfect size to fit everything I need. I feel the 12 would be too small and the 72 would be too big for my needs. All of the zippers run flawlessly. Very good stitching throughout. The straps are at the perfect spot for comfortable carry for hours. LOTS of different sized compartments.
customer_reviews.author: Mike S.

customer_reviews.title: love. Love. LOVE this bag!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bag in a 24 and a 72 for myself. I loved this bag so much, I also bought a couple of 24s for my brothers' emergency bags, and will soon purchase some for the rest of my family. They are great material, durable, yet not too rough (so often tactical bags are rough on the skin and the shoulder and underarm area is soft and rough materials can rub and irritate the skin), but these bags feel better to the touch compared to other models I ended up returning. The padded straps and shoulder support makes all the difference! You cannot go wrong with 5.11 bags or products. You will not regret buying this bag. #AddToCart
customer_reviews.author: Perla

customer_reviews.title: Best Backpack I’ve Ever Owned
customer_reviews.text: Best backpack I’ve ever owned. Very well made. I use it everyday for work after fancy leather satchel needed to be replaced. I don’t anticipate this one needing to be replaced anytime soon if ever in my lifetime. The 24 is comparable to traditional backpack size for high school/college students. It has plenty of room for my purposes. My wife and I are considered buying and using the 12 as baby bag for our son who is on the way.
customer_reviews.author: George P. Goodman

customer_reviews.title: the rubber pads below the shoulder straps are pretty much worn out too
customer_reviews.text: Bought it in January for a laptop bag. Less than a year later, the bottom part of the bag started falling apart. You would think that the designers would make the bottom a little more durable than just a single layer, but light use of just carrying a laptop will start wearing holes on the bottom. Also, the rubber pads below the shoulder straps are pretty much worn out too. So don't expect this thing to last longer than a year.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Paulson

customer_reviews.title: Quite possibly the greatest backpack of all time.
customer_reviews.text: It really is. I do disaster response and have been through a backpack every year or 2 and nothing has held up or has as much storage organization as this bag. Its a bit pricey, but in this case you are paying for the quality of the bag. YKK zippers throughout, plus all the pockets, cinch straps and water bladder pocket (Geigerrig preferred). This bag will withstand me overfilling it, slugging it though the dirt and hauling my laptop almost every day. I am extremely happy and this is my favorite backpack I have ever owned. Thank you 5.11 for producing such an amazing product.
customer_reviews.author: C. Adams

customer_reviews.title: No warranty. I returned it before I touched it, Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your time on this if you don't want to regret it later. I just received it, It looks great, and I would've liked to keep it, but, there is no warranty on behalf of Amazon or 5.11 for this bag. Buyer Beware.
customer_reviews.author: Åńdrêw Çøłïn

customer_reviews.title: Great overall quality / No complaints
customer_reviews.text: So many uses from this bag. Been hiking and stayed out for a weekend and it fits all my necessities and more. Great for when I go out with my son. Usually keep clothes, water bottle, first aid kit, and more. Holds so much with great organization options. Highly recommend if you like quality products 5.11 won’t disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: Jusburnin_dc5

customer_reviews.title: My favorite backpack.
customer_reviews.text: I cannot complain. This thing is built like a tank. Stitching is solid. Holds over 50lbs of stuff with no problem. It also has a bunch of pockets. This bag is meant for duty. I love all the molle on it too. I'm all about aesthetics and practicality, so the fact that it has many pockets and has the molle feature makes this a huge plus for me. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: JoshTech 010291

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pack! At first
customer_reviews.text: Awesome pack! At first, I thought it might have been a little small when I received it. Since I purchased it to use as a range bag, I figured it would suffice. Then took it on a 5 day trip and was able to fit 4 days of clothes, extra shoes and a plethora of other stuff in it. Seeing it fully packed I started thinking maybe it was too large :). Overall, I'm sure this will be a good durable bag that'll last many years.
customer_reviews.author: JBogs

customer_reviews.title: They are color blind
customer_reviews.text: Well made bag BUT their colors are not whats shown. I needed a light tan (sand) colored bag and their "Dark Earth" looks quit tan but is really only a tad lighter green than OD. Their "Sandstone is a very dark green" and had to send that one back. Wish they made a REAL desert/Sand color bag. lower openings zippers stick on the "curve"
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Quality
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this pack for exactly five years. I use it almost everyday (lovingly known as BOB, Bug Out Bag). It has just in the last month developed one small inch long rip along a seam on one of the backpack straps. Even the MOLLE straps, which get a fair bit of use, are holding strong.
customer_reviews.author: KMJ Esquire

customer_reviews.title: Great backpack.
customer_reviews.text: Love this backpack. I've had it for a little over 2 years now and it has held up very well. Aside from some minor fraying along to the top of the shoulder straps. I use it for school, work, camping, and just everyday things. Nice large area to hold a water bladder with a removable hard plastic backing plate. Many pockets to hold all your belongings. And a sunglasses pouch. The bag it's self is a little on the heavy side but I'll take it for its durability.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin St.Onge

customer_reviews.title: Spent the money and got the best.
customer_reviews.text: It's a good durable pack with numerous compartments. I added a few pouches on the outside for water and fuel to avoid any internal spills. The yoke and straps are as comfortable as they can be. I spent a little extra money for this pack and expect to be using it for many years.
customer_reviews.author: Heard Of Me

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny, and then some
customer_reviews.text: I can see why this is one of the most highly reviewed tactical packs out there, the hype is real fellas. Sturdy construction, easily accessible compartments thanks to the 180 degree zip liners. Fully molle compatible on just about the entire bag (even the straps where I mounted a phone pouch for my iphoneX - yes it fits). Great usage of space, I love the hydration pocket on otherwise dead space.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Great backpack!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my commuter backpack, it was showing a lot of wear and tear after only a year. I decided to splurge on a more rugged backpack, and I'm glad that I did. I am loving this backpack. I bought two MOLLE water bottle holder for it, 1 for my water bottle and the other for my coffee mug. It has a lot of pockets for organizing my items, and this is an updated version with the bottom loops and updated shoulder harness. If you're looking at this backpack, just buy it and be done!
customer_reviews.author: Timothypaul26

customer_reviews.title: Best backpack I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Best backpack I've ever owned, I get lots of compliments on it and love the functionality and flawless quality, this is a very wellade product. Considering the dozens of features, zippers, pockets, straps and padding it is impressive that there isn't a single poor stitch or seam. Highly recommended. My coworker has the same bag only his is a few years old, a daily use bag and it looks as new as mine.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Collier

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I chose this backpack because of the YKK zippers. I was not disappointed at all. After working out the initial stiffness the zippers are the best I have ever had on a backpack. Moves that required 2 hands and some tugging on my other packs are easily done with 1 hand on this pack. I did finally figure out how to adjust the sternum straps, the d-rings can be unhooked and moved to another loop. Great pockets, and enough of them.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Great general use pack!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a month ago to replace my cheap backpack for everyday use and camping. It's proved to be a great edc pack so far with plenty of compartments for all my gear. Soon after buying it I went on a trip for the weekend to Uwharrie National Forest and this pack easily handled my clothes and toiletries for the trip. So far the only thing I've found about it that's a little bothersome is that its a little larger than I would like for a dedicated edc pack. Since I bought it to double as a camping pack though, its something I'm happy to deal with.
customer_reviews.author: Terrance

customer_reviews.title: The 10 was good for working events and as a light day pack ...
customer_reviews.text: Previously I owned the RUSH10, until it was stolen from me. Well the time came again to buy another bag and I knew I wanted 5.11. The 10 was good for working events and as a light day pack for kayaking, but I decided to step up to the 24 and don’t regret it a bit. Plenty of storage with proper division of space with all of the pockets. The side zip pockets fit a plastic water bottle perfectly without invading the main compartment. The ykk zippers make opening and closing a breeze. And the back padding and shoulder straps make carrying the pack as comfortable as you could want. 10/10 would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: James Diffley

customer_reviews.title: Quality pack
customer_reviews.text: This pack is well thought out, and built. I got it as a replacement for an older, similar size pack. It has plenty of internal organization pouches/dividers. As of this writing, I have not put the pack to a field test. If this pack lives up to expectations, I would like to upgrade to the larger version.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Brown

customer_reviews.title: Still strong after hundreds of miles
customer_reviews.text: I have had this backpack for about a year and a half now. It has logged hundreds of miles of day hikes and it is still in excellent condition. To date, I have had no problems or complaints about this pack. The one and only thing I would suggest is to offer a hip belt as an add-on purchase for those carrying heavy loads. I have become a fan of 5.11 products ( I also own a pair of 5.11 tactical pants that I use for hiking) and their durability and I will continue buy their products.
customer_reviews.author: Shellback

customer_reviews.title: Too big for EDC
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bag to be my medic EDC. The Rush12 would have been a better choice since I am adding specific molle pouches for different items (CPR, bandages, trauma gear, etc.). So I will just have a large EDC and carry rescue gear with the medic gear. Great bag.
customer_reviews.author: S. quashnick

customer_reviews.title: Rugged backpack finally found.
customer_reviews.text: This backpack embodies rugged. I'm active duty military and can already tell I'm going to love toting this thing around on deployments. It's obviously designed for military as it has the velcro for your name tape which I've already put on there. It's roomy, got plenty of zippers, pockets, and you can tell it's very rugged which is the most important. My last backpack was a $25 dollar JanSport that snapped at one of the straps. I can tell this won't happen here and I will get years of use out of this thing. Well worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: Delerak

customer_reviews.title: This is used as a 72 hour SAR bag and ...
customer_reviews.text: This is used as a 72 hour SAR bag and it is rugged enough to hold up under use. There are many well-designed pockets, flaps, and compartments thoughtfully built in. This is large enough to hold some serious gear but not so big that you can't wear it most of the day! This is a quality well made mil spec pack!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen C. Dowdy

customer_reviews.title: I own several Rush products
customer_reviews.text: 5.11 has hit out of the park with the Rush Tactical Backpack series. I own several and I have been happy with them all. They are not just built as a smaller version of the larger 72 but each function as an independent product with there own purpose. You will not be disappointed...
customer_reviews.author: TomJ

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: The buckle on the shoulder strap broke after 3 months of regular use. I barely had anything heavy in it at all. You can't really replace the buckle because it was sewn into the shoulder strap. There's no warrantee or return policies after 30 days.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Best bag I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: I've used this bag everyday for almost two months. And I love it! I use it for work. I pack my chargers and battery packs and other misc items and it the best bag I've ever owned and highly recommended this to anyone. I like 5.11 products so much a I purchased a companion for my Rush 24, the Moab 10 from 5.11 I love this bag as well. So if your considering getting this GO FOR IT! You won't regret it!
customer_reviews.author: slyman64

customer_reviews.title: Great backpack.
customer_reviews.text: Got for my son's elementary school backpack. He needs lots of extra room for snow gear, and thus will definetly do the trick.
customer_reviews.author: D.filli

customer_reviews.title: This bag rocks!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the bag with the intention of taking it on deployment to Germany and use it as my daily carry. So far the bag holds all that I need. It has numerous pockets that I can hold all my camera / operational supplies in. The zippers are quality with nice thread pulls on them. I have only had the bag for a few weeks as of yet and cannot speak to its durability. I will update once I’m back from deployment. The Bag is comfortable with nice wide straps. So far no complaints. We shall see.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: High Quality, Great Bag.
customer_reviews.text: I love my new EDC backpack. I did all the research from 5.11 product videos to YouTube reviews and reading countless reviews on Amazon. I chose the Rush 24 over the Rush 12 because of the side exterior pockets and a more capable upper front pocket. It's a spot on product. Great quality and vast amount organization. After I rotated all my gear from the old into this bag, I could hardly tell just by looking at it there's gear in it. Just loads of options. Seriously if you're on the fence about which EDC carry pack to go with, 5.11 Rush 24 will not disappoint. Carry on.
customer_reviews.author: Boogz, ya dig?

customer_reviews.title: Looks good, fits well.
customer_reviews.text: Use this to travel internationally as carry on luggage and it fits everywhere it should hold everything it needs to and is very comfortable to wear. Lots of pockets and compartments to store small and medium sized items. But don't just take my word for it, do a search on youtube and there are dozens of review videos there. Also black is a nice color to carry through the airport and TSA checkpoints as opposed to more "military" colors, just as robust with out the unwanted attention...
customer_reviews.author: John N

customer_reviews.title: My Go-To Bag!
customer_reviews.text: This backback is awesome! I've transitioned out if a shoulder bag into this one for work/every day commuting. Laptop, headphones, ipad, chords and chargers, notebooks, papers, multiple pairs of glasses. That's just the beginning! May be too much for smaller frames, but I'm 5'10" 165lbs and its perfect on my back. Strap contour and chest strap take a lot of the weight. Feels less than what I'm carrying. As for aesthetics- the grey and black is super sweet! Picked up a Jedi morale patch to complete it! Not flimsy to the touch. Screams quality! Definitely worth the buy.
customer_reviews.author: S_the_Riot

customer_reviews.title: Great backback
customer_reviews.text: My first time out with this backpack I went to the store. I was able to fit 30 lbs of groceries in it with no problems at all. The straps are very nice and comfortable. I am using it as my EDC. avg weight is a out 15 lbs. You don't even feel that is on.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Best Beg
customer_reviews.text: I often carry a lot of stuff with me everywhere I go. This bag offers an amazing durability. The size option is great, and the pockets allows the option to keep everything organized and still have plenty of room in the main pocket. This is one of the best bags I've ever owned and the price is great.
customer_reviews.author: darkangel

customer_reviews.title: Good pack, perfect size
customer_reviews.text: So far I like it. Plenty of space, lots of pockets to stash anything from small stuff to a 15" laptop and more Taking it in a vacation soon. We'll see how it holds up I have a 75 litre bag but that's too big unless I'm doing a multi-day hike. The Rush bag is just right for everyday use
customer_reviews.author: David Randolph

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Pack!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I've bought. I've had the first for about 4 years and put it through the ringer. Used it hard, abused it harder. Aside from replacing a zipper pull or two everything else is still solid. No pulled stitching or seam failures. And it has so much organization to the internal layout that I can access anything in the pack quickly. I highly recommend this as a solid work horse of a back pack.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick McKinney

customer_reviews.title: Great Durable Pack
customer_reviews.text: It's a great durable pack with a ton of internal pockets. I use it as my "man purse" for weekend family events as well as overnight excursions. I knocked off one star due to its weight and the fact that it never seems to be able to sit upright when packed and on a flat surface (i.e., it wants to lean/tip away from the straps). I strongly recommend adding at least one of ITS' skeletonized bottle holders on the side MOLLE webbing for quick bottle access unless you're going to use a bladder pouch and tube (which is possible with this pack too). The zippered side pouches are good for a small umbrella or smaller water bottle.
customer_reviews.author: KIND

customer_reviews.title: Great bag!
customer_reviews.text: I'm SO angry! I bought this for my son, and now I HAVE to buy another... fur myself. The bag is very well made, with strong stitching. The webbing makes it easy to attach other components as you wish. Whether creating a premier's 'Go' bag, or a simple overnight hiking pack, you won't go wrong with this pack. Now I just have to convince my wife that I NEED one. Why didn't I buy one for myself first?
customer_reviews.author: M. D. MCBRIDE

customer_reviews.title: This backpack is the perfect size for me
customer_reviews.text: This backpack is the perfect size for me. I was able to get my 15 inch laptop into it, unlike the Rush 12, Maxpedition Condor II, or Falcon 2. Materials are high quality. Should last quite a long time. The fabric of the 5.11 is much softer than the Maxpedition line. It breaks in very quickly unlike the Maxpedition, but as such, in a year, looks a bit worn in. Not that it is falling apart, but definitely looks used. My Maxpedition day carrys, look much newer after the same time.
customer_reviews.author: ERicincal

customer_reviews.title: Great as a carryon
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 of these bags. Have used it as a carryon while travelling I airports, over night bag for hotels, and even for some short hikes and fishing. Decent size, I was able to carry a 17" laptop, with charder and a few peripherals while still carrying enough clothes for 3 days on a work trip. It has no frame so it is not good for any heavy or extended hikes
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great bag, very solid.
customer_reviews.text: Great bag for traveling. It is relatively light when empty which is great. Very well made like the other Rush/Moab packs. Plenty of pockets for organization and the straps are comfortable even with a heavy load. Highly recommend this pack an their other Rush/Moab bags. You can't go wrong with 5.11 Rush/Moab lines.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Best day pack EVER! Yet another 5 star product from 5.11!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! The 5.11 Rush Backpack is heads and tails the best day pack I've ever owned. I've owned day packs from a number of top end outfitters over the years. They may as well be be pink and have a cartoon character stamped on them by comparison. This pack is astoundingly rugged, versatile, and well conceived. I'm still not sure I've found all of the thoughtfully designed storage compartments this pack offers. I watched the 5.11 video on this product and it doesn't begin to illustrate the awe inspiring design and versatility. Yet another 5 star product from 5.11!
customer_reviews.author: A. Davis

customer_reviews.title: 5.11 Tactical Backpack
customer_reviews.text: So far it’s awesome, wore it on several flights between North Carolina and Alaska, no issues with back pain even with it packed to the brim. It is rather large for my small body but I knew that buying it. Lots of pockets! Seems like the zippers are good quality. Not sure that it’s water proof seeing as there’s riveted holes in the bottom but so far nothing inside has gotten wet.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty Pack - Updated Design
customer_reviews.text: The pack is great and seems much larger than I thought it would be. Construction and quality also seem to be better than expected. The pack I received is the new updated design which includes the new rain fly over zippers and the attachment/lashing points on the bottom of the pack. The only reason I am not giving a five star review is because I think the pack would really benefit from another set of compression straps toward the bottom to help hold the contents tightly. I plan to attach my own compression straps using the molle and hopefully it will work.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Great multi-purpose backpack.
customer_reviews.text: This bag functions well for both hiking and everyday use. On the average day I keep it filled with a few books, writing implements, a change of clothes, a laptop, a digital camera, and additional lenses. Everything is compartmentalized and easy to find, and the weight is disributed well so it is comfortable to wear. When used for hiking it has pockets for just about everything you could imagine, so nothing gets lost or takes a long time to search for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: After reading all the reviews on this bag, I got it for my teenaged son. Reviews were right on. If you want quality, durability, and a backpack that is functional for being out in the woods, hiking, traveling or just for school, you won't be sorry. He loves it. There are plenty of compartment and built solid for years of use. They sent us a complimentary smaller 12 backpack which is smaller than this and it is superb, just smaller that can be used for daily trips out. My son uses the Day Rush for weekend swim meets. I'm an outdoorsman. The 1 Day Rush is on my wish list.
customer_reviews.author: parkale

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag.  Lots of storage spaces.  Waiting to pull some hard duty to see how this bag holds up.
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice bag. I have not subjected the bag to any hard duty just yet but it seems to be well-put-together and has adequate pockets and spaces for my things. Shoulder padding seems adequate but I have not yet carried any substantial loads. This could have been a five star product of 5.11 could have added one more small pouch right above the admin area. My Maxpedition bag that I have used for over 10 Years has the admin/pouch arrangement and has been highly useful for storing quick access items.
customer_reviews.author: CMP

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Used this for a solo winter camp in the Catskills. Unbelievable the amount of kit I managed to fit in this pack. Full winter sleeping bag, rations, thermal and puffy jacket. My tent and sleeping pad attached to the webbing on top and underneath no problem. I was debating bringing my 75 liter Bergen but this pack got me through and was a delight to rock scramble up and down a few mountains. Best pack I’ve owned/been issued.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as it appears
customer_reviews.text: I liked that it was an actual 5.11 brand backpack, however the product that came looked nothing like the picture; it had one big compartment for storage, inside said compartment it had two zippers for a 3x5 pockets. I’ll say it wasn’t a complete loss because I decided to gift it to someone in my family, mostly because it wasn’t the product I wanted and I don't like returning stuff. On a side note, I had bought a “Black” pack, it was actually urban gray, so whatever.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Jennings

customer_reviews.title: QUITE REMARKABLE AT THIS PRICE POINT!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a quality BUG-OUT BAG. In this one, I would store "high quality food". In a worst case situation, my wife would be packing this one. Upon first impression, what really stands out is the quality of construction. The stitching is EXCELLENT! And, it has been given a lot of thought to it's lay-out. I suspect, 5.11 had a lot of input from some special operations people. As you can see I've started to pack it with "bug-out" food. Actually, most of the food stored, you can't see. Still, I have plenty of room. The pack I carry has most of the heaver stuff, it's nice but, not this good.
customer_reviews.author: Nevadasun

customer_reviews.title: Use this as a Dad/Diaper bag!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect dad/diaper bag. Best thing about it is that will around as your kid grows because it's built to last. Tough heavy duty material, straps, pockets, and zippers. However I did swap out my zipper pulls but it's definitely not necessary. Plenty of storage space for more than a days worth of gear not only the baby's but your's as well. Comfortable to wear and carry.
customer_reviews.author: J. McLeod

customer_reviews.title: Good Student Bag
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my school books and bicycle commuting. Comfortable and a little padding to help protect the electronics. Lot's of places to hang things like cap, gloves, etc. A side pocket for my water bottle would be nice, but I think there are probably small bags to hang for that purpose.
customer_reviews.author: K. Bond

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money on any other bags
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owned the Rush72 bag for about 5 years now and it was time for a new one. So I went with the smaller Rush24. 5.11 makes these best bags for be ever owned and that comes from 14 years of military service
customer_reviews.author: Ryan M Hooten

customer_reviews.title: It's perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a bag I can grab when going camping or just leave in a truck as a "get home bag" in case something crazy happens. Used to laugh at doomsday preppers but the way things are going its starting to make some sense.
customer_reviews.author: Anton

customer_reviews.title: From EDC Bag to Zombie Apocalypse Survival!
customer_reviews.text: I'm really impressed with this bag. It cost more than I wanted to spend, but now, after the fact, I'm glad I spent a little more. It seems like 5.11 went over the design for this thing over and over again thinking "How can we make this bag better?" It has just tons of little things about it that make it an awesome bag, and it feels like it will survive a long time during the Zombie Apocalypse. I use it for my EDC bag, but to each, his own. It does fit a 17.3" laptop, in case anyone is wondering about that, plus room for a change of clothes, books, and your EDC junk...all at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: they absolutely love them. These packs are really awesome and of ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought 6 of these packs for my team, they absolutely love them. These packs are really awesome and of high quality, for the price you can't get a better pack. 5.11 tactical gear is always of high quality and you know you are getting a product that is going to last. I own several things from them and I have yet to be dissappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jack07

customer_reviews.title: Exceeds Expectations!
customer_reviews.text: I loaded mine with 45lbs of rock to conduct core strength training. The pack carries it was no issue. No signs of wear or weakening what so ever. I’m very impressed with the quality and functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff York

customer_reviews.title: Great Bag.  I love it.  Recommended.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not one for writing long reviews. I'll just say I'm very satisfied with this purchase thus far after a week. Used it right away on a business trip and worked out great. If you need to put your laptop in here I would suggest some additional protection such as putting the laptop in a padded sleeve. I don't think this is a negative as I knew going in this was not meant as a laptop bag by design. The other thing of note is that the nylon is very heavy duty which I think adds to the weight and such. I like it but be aware it is pretty rough and durable.
customer_reviews.author: TruValor

customer_reviews.title: RUSH 24.  Well Made Go Bag.
customer_reviews.text: Good Bag. High Quality. Its bigger than I expected. Looking forward to getting the RUSH 12 for a grab and go-bag. I like the top outer zipper on the RUSH 12 Better. Check out the side zippers on this one. Its not for everyone. GREAT PACK!! Great packs for putting together your emergency gear bag.
customer_reviews.author: Sky

customer_reviews.title: Great get home bag
customer_reviews.text: I did a LOT of research before buying this pack. Still wondering if should have gotten the 72 hour version, but suspect after I get this loaded, the weight will be about the max I would want to carry for any extended period. Quality is excellent. Layout is about the best I saw from any manufacturer for this kind of pack. Price seems high, but all of the quality packs seem pretty high priced to me. The best price I found was here on amazon, but a big margin.
customer_reviews.author: TruthTeller

customer_reviews.title: This bag is HUGE in a good way
customer_reviews.text: Very very very nice backpack. Im using it for crossfit and my size 7 metcons fit in the front pocket! It is a pretty big bag but I felt the rush12 was going to be too small for extra pants a hoodie and shoes I need for after a workout. I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Gustavo

customer_reviews.title: very heavy on its own, but a great back pack if that doesn't bother you.
customer_reviews.text: The backpack is great in terms of size and organization. The only problem is how heavy it is on its own. The straps and clip help a bit, but I had no idea the pack would be this heavy. It was not really what I was looking for. But if you can carry lots of weight, the pack is roomy and very organized. I would not want to carry anything heavy inside it, however, which is too bad, because it seems like it cold handle quite a load.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Federici

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I am a police officer and I was in search of a new patrol bag. This one is the perfect fit. It has a lot of zippers and pockets to organize and separate what I need. Great quality and you cannot go wrong with 511, this is a bag that you don't need to caudle and can treat how you want without something happening to it.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Go for it!
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing bag! Incredibly well made and can take a beating! I took it hiking for 2 weeks in Austria and was able to carry everything I need and then some! Straps are super comfy and it felt great! Side note, it doesn't come with a hip strap, so buy some nylon webbing (Country Brook Design® 1 1/2 Inch Heavy Black Polypro Webbing, 25 Yards is perfect) and clips/buckle (Side Release Buckle 1-1/2"-Black is great) and the Condor 'Battle Belt' (Condor Gen II Battle Belt). You'll just thread the nylon webbing through the tri-glides and the battle belt and you're all set.
customer_reviews.author: nunya buisness

customer_reviews.title: Works with Titan 30 lb ruck plate
customer_reviews.text: I bought this primarily for rucking with a 30 lb. Titan ruck plate. I was initially disappointed, because the plate just flopped around in the large, main compartment because the fabric divider for a laptop compartment couldn't secure the weight. Then I realized that it fit perfectly in the hydration compartment. A larger weight would probably not fit, but it fits the 30 lb plate like a glove. I've already put on a bunch of miles, and the weight is secure, and the straps are comfortable. I'm very happy with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Cooke

customer_reviews.title: Best backpack I ever bought.
customer_reviews.text: This backpack is an absolute monster. It can hold so much, and it has so many little compartments that are extremely handy for my usual every day carry. I've had notable amounts of people comment how great it looks, for it does not look too aggressive but at the same time looks very tactical and rugged. I carry a lot of stuff everyday, and this bag never fails to get the job done. 5/5
customer_reviews.author: some dude

customer_reviews.title: Good ergonomic design - sturdy construction
customer_reviews.text: Lots of inner zippered pockets to keep things where you can find them easily. Great ergonomics - transfers some of the load to the upper gluteals - makes it easy to walk for hours without muscle strain in the shoulders.
customer_reviews.author: Hugo Furst

customer_reviews.title: So Far So Good
customer_reviews.text: The package showed up as scheduled and it good condition. I do a lot of traveling and this backpack seems to fit everything I need. It seems well put together and I will be using it greatly!
customer_reviews.author: Steve LaMarr

customer_reviews.title: I literally never leave home without it
customer_reviews.text: As a first responder and in the army reserves im gone for anywhere from 1 to 7 day stretches at my normal job. This bag packs EVERYTHING i need and over 5 years later of heavy use and abuse it looks like its brand new in perfect condition. extremely durable, Tons of storage, fits everything i need but still small an comfortable to carry. Excellent. 10/10.
customer_reviews.author: prayerofdeath

customer_reviews.title: Last bag I'll have to buy
customer_reviews.text: I have been eying this bag for about a year, as my previous Kelty backpack deteriorated from every day us. This bag has so many spots for all the gear, gym clothes, first aid, etc. that you need for your rigorous daily routines. Don't waste your time with other brands, if you want pure quality stick with 5.11
customer_reviews.author: Michael Mohr

customer_reviews.title: Perfect backpack.
customer_reviews.text: Great product - pockets everywhere. One thing is that I should have gotten a desert camo one as trying to see stuff inside a black backpack is not easy. One thing is that the bottom plastic 'things' that a strap loops through for back support sometimes digs into my sides if ALL of the straps aren't adjusted correctly, and even then I still feel them a little. I'm pretty big (6'4"/245lbs), so that may be the reason. Still in all no dings to the review - love this pack.
customer_reviews.author: Larry C. Lawson

customer_reviews.title: Great bag
customer_reviews.text: I use this backpack every day to and from work and has held up very well. I do wish the bottom of the bag was a bit more rigid as if you have any heavy item like a multi tool it bows out a little bit but other then that it is a great bag
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Standing Up to Alaska Wilderness
customer_reviews.text: A great price on this tactical backpack. It has stood up well to heavy use in Alaska and we would buy it again in a second. Read through the features. This is larger than the classic backpack but not huge. Perfect for hunting, hiking, or just use by anyone who wants a hardy bag. The pockets are all useful and this is well designed.
customer_reviews.author: AlaskaAmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Great bag
customer_reviews.text: I own all 3 Rush backpacks (12, 24, 72) and they are all excellent. I'm a pilot and I use this one for my flight bag. It carries my charts, headsets, snacks, a couple small airplane related tools, and tons of other stuff. I have a few things attached with MOLLE such as a water bottle holder, a sunglasses case, a flashlight pouch, and a radio pouch. All things I like to have on the outside to grab easily. I've had this one for nearly 3 months now and used it a lot and it shows no signs of wear. Had it 2.5 years of daily use and it's good as new.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy R. Reed

product_meta.title: 5.11 Tactical RUSH24 Military Backpack, Molle Bag Rucksack Pack, 37 Liter Medium, Style 58601
product_meta.description: Our most popular tactical backpack, the RUSH24 is a high-performance tactical pack suitable for active duty, hunting and recreation, or grab-and-go. Compatible with 5.11 Tier System and Scabbard, the pack features unmatched storage capability, a wrap-around MOLLE and SlickStick-compatible web platform, adjustable shoulder and sternum straps, a 60-oz. hydration pocket, and durable, water-resistant construction. It's a back pack built to be ready for anything. Shop the Rush Collection.
feature_bullets: Quite simply the best tactical military backpack on the market. This Rucksack bug out bag features a roomy main storage area, dual zipping side pockets and a stuff-it pocket with integrated draw cord and glove friendly pull tabs
Rush24 Molle tactical backpack bag has a reinforced grab-and-go handle, hydration pocket, zippered fleece-lined eyewear pocket and wrap-around MOLLE/SlickStick web platform
Military Style Tactical Backpack has 2275 cubic inch / 37 liter total capacity with Twin drainage grommets, and self-repairing YKK zippers. Perfect to use as a patrol backpack or trekking pack

Also has three mesh admin compartments, zippered side water bottle pocket and a hook and loop area for nametape and flag patches. Water-repellant coating and has two external compression straps and a contoured yoke shoulder strap system

The Rush24 tactical military backpack can be used as a multipurpose pack, bug out bag, range bag, hunting backpack, survival back pack, army backpack, sling bag, hiking rucksack, or every day outdoor backpack
